div.div:
Bond 2020 BHISD will have a Bond Election beginning with early voting from April 20-28 and concluding on election day, May 2. All precincts will vote at the C.T. Joseph Conference Center. All registered voters are eligible to vote by mail.
Learn More

section.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsSlideshow home-news fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_0 fsSlideshowHorizontal

img.alt: 2020 Bond Election

div.p: BHISD will have a Bond Election beginning with early voting from April 20-28 and concluding on election day, May 2. Voting by mail is also available.
Registration for regular Pre K students requires students to be declared eligible for services.The Texas Legislature determines eligibility requirements for free, public Pre K in Texas.

article.a: Continue Reading about Regular Pre-K Eligibility

div.p: Anyone needing to register/withdraw students, please set up an appointment with Kelly Barrera. She is available by phone at 281-576-2221, ext. 1278 or by email at rbarrera@bhisd.net.

article.a: Continue Reading about Student Registration & Withdrawal

div.p: Beginning March 16, 2020, the Barbers Hill ISD Tax Office lobby will be closed while the school district is operating under modified conditions as we strive to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

article.a: Continue Reading about Tax Office Lobby Closure

img.alt: 2020-21 District Calendar

div.p: Barbers Hill 2020-2021 School Calendar has been approved!

img.alt: Public Notice

div.p: It is the policy of Barbers Hill ISD not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex or handicap in its vocational programs, services or activities as required by Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972; and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.

article.a: Continue Reading about Public Notification of Nondiscrimination

div.p: The 2018-19 Federal Report Card is now available for each campus of Barbers Hill ISD.

article.a: Continue Reading about 2018-2019 Federal Report Card

BHISD is committed to school safety. Read about how we are implementing new measures.
Spotlight on Safety
BHISD 2020 Bond Election

BHISD will have a Bond Election beginning with early voting from April 20-28 and concluding on election day, May 2. All precincts will vote at the C.T. Joseph Conference Center. All registered voters are eligible to vote by mail.
Bond 2020

div.div: What's happening on The Hill

div.p:
If you would like to have a community event listed on the site, please read the Guidelines For Approval of and Access to Flyers and complete the Flyer Distribution Request Form.

div.p: Information for returning student registration for the 2020-21 school year is available on the Returning Student Registration webpage.
April 20 - 28

C.T. Joseph Conference Center
9600 Eagle Drive
Mont Belvieu, TX

8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m., Monday - Friday
7:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m. April 21 & April 28

Saturday, May 2
7:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m.

All precincts will vote at the same location:
C. T. Joseph Conference Center
9600 Eagle Drive
Mont Belvieu, TX
To vote by mail, applications must be received by the Early Voting Clerk's office no later than Monday, April 20.
For absentee application, visit bhisd.net/district/elections.
Print Bond Information Flyer (PDF) English
20 al 28 de abril

Centro de Conferencia C.T. Joseph
9600 Eagle Drive
Mont Belvieu, TX

8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m., lunes - viernes
7:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m. 21 de abril y 28 de abril

sábado 2 de mayo
7:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m.

Todos los precintos votarán en el mismo lugar:
Centro de Conferencia C.T. Joseph
9600 Eagle Drive
Mont Belvieu, TX
Para la solicitud de ausencia, visite bhisd.net/district/elections.
Print Bond Information Flyer (PDF) Spanish
